header.subject: HYDRAULIC POWER - Hydraulic System Pressure Check

summary.background: In June 2020, a potential issue was identified with the hydraulic systems on the 737-8 and 737-9 airplanes, which could lead to hydraulic pressure loss. Boeing decided to issue a service bulletin to perform a hydraulic system pressure check to ensure safe and reliable operations.
summary.description: This service bulletin provides instructions for performing a hydraulic system pressure check on the affected airplanes.

planning_information.reason: To address the identified potential issue with the hydraulic systems on the 737-8 and 737-9 airplanes, which could lead to hydraulic pressure loss.

description.step: 1. Perform a hydraulic system pressure check on all three hydraulic systems.
2. Check for any leaks and rectify as necessary.

planning_information.compliance: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has issued an Airworthiness Directive related to this service bulletin, making the compliance tasks and times given in this service bulletin mandatory.
planning_information.approval: This service bulletin was examined by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). The actions specified in this service bulletin comply with the applicable regulations and are FAA approved, as well as European Aviation Safety Agency (EASA)/Joint Aviation Authorities (JAA) approved for all EASA/JAA approved airplanes listed in the service bulletin effectivity.

step.text: RC - Perform a pressure check on the A, B, and standby hydraulic systems using pressure gauges as per AMM 29-11-00.
RC - Check for any hydraulic leaks and rectify as necessary according to AMM 29-11-00.

section.title: 1. Hydraulic System Pressure Check Instructions
section.content: Ensure all safety procedures are followed while performing the hydraulic system pressure check. Use the pressure gauges specified in the tooling required section. Verify the hydraulic systems are functioning correctly and there are no leaks.
